<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The BuildMem function may be used with the BuildMI function to add entire</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// memory references in a single, typed, function call.  X86 memory references</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// can be very complex expressions (described in the README), so wrapping them</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// up behind an easier to use interface makes sense.  Descriptions of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// functions are included below.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For reference, the order of operands for memory references is:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (Operand), Base, Scale, Index, Displacement.</span></CodeLine>
